definition[0]: used to emphasize how small or unimportant something or someone is
example[0]: She lost the election by a mere 20 votes.
example[2]: It can’t be a mere coincidence that they left at the same time.
definition[1]: used to emphasize that something which is small or not extreme has a big effect or is important
example[3]: The merest little noise makes him nervous.
example[4]: The mere thought of food made her feel sick.
example[5]: The mere fact that the talks are continuing is a positive sign.
